Title: New parents? And not getting enough sleep? May be this can help
Narrative:
💤Taking the morning off
Whoever responds during the night then takes time off in the morning to get some uninterrupted sleep whilst another
caregiver looks after the child/children.

🛏Take the night off
Choosing one night per week/fortnight/month where the primary nighttime caregiver takes a full night off to sleep.

💤Break it up
Splitting the night into two shifts, and taking a shift each. You can find a rhythm of taking the same shift every night. 

🛏Time it together
Going to bed at the same time as or just slightly after your baby, maximising your own sleep and rest time.

💤Catch the nap
Napping when your baby is napping, or during any time when another care giver is watching your child.

What steps do you use? Leave a note to let us know.
